greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: CGT-tree negating involution of nonnegative integers.
comment: This involution negates game trees used in the combinatorial game theory, when they are encoded in the way explained in A106486.
Cycles are confined into ranges [a(n),a(n+1)[, where a(0)=0 and a(n+1)=2^(2*a(n)), i.e. the ranges are [0,0], [1,3], [4,255], [256,(2^512)-1], ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1023
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
xref: A057300 is a "shallow" version which just swaps the left and right options of the game tree, but does not reflect the subtrees themselves. Cf. A106486-A106487.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 21 2005
